name: "Behold" the Bible Quiz | Bible: Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: When Jesus was hanging on the cross, to whom was he referring to when he said, "Woman, behold thy son!"?
questions.explanation:
The disciple whom he loved.

	Jesus was referring to John when told his mother to behold her son. After hearing that, John took Mary into his home and his family. Jesus' proclamation can be found in John 19:26 (KJV).

questions.text: In the KJV, who said, "Behold the blood of the covenant, which the Lord hath made with you concerning all these words."?
questions.explanation:
Moses.

	While Moses was speaking these words, he sprinkled half the blood of the sacrificed oxen onto the children of Israel while the other half was sprinkled on an altar. Moses' words can be found in Exodus 24:8 (KJV).

questions.text: Upon seeing Jesus walking toward him, who uttered, "Behold the Lamb of God which taketh away the sins of the world"?
questions.explanation:
John the Baptist.

	John saw Jesus at the Jordan River while he was baptizing people. He uttered this statement to let the people know who was coming into their midst. John uttered this proclamation in John 1:29 (KJV).

questions.text: "Behold, I bring Him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in Him." Who spoke these words about Jesus in John 19:4 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Pilate.

	After Jesus had been beaten and a crown of thorns placed on his head, Pilate gave Jesus to the people because he couldn't find anything that the man had done wrong.

questions.text: What book of the KJV Bible has God stating, "Behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places."?
questions.explanation:
Genesis.

	Jacob left Beersheba and entered into Haran. When nighttime came, Jacob took two stones to use as pillows. While asleep God spoke to him. When Jacob awoke, he named the place of his dream Bethel. Jacob's dream can be found in Genesis 28 (KJV).

questions.text: In what book of the KJV Bible did an angel proclaim, "Behold the place where they laid him"?
questions.explanation:
Mark.

	Instead of finding Jesus in the sepulchre where He had been buried, an angel told two of Jesus' disciples to look at the place where they had laid Him because He was no longer there. The angel's words can be found in Mark 16:6 (KJV).

questions.text: After an angel told Mary that she would conceive a child, she proclaimed, "Behold the ________ of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word". Finish the quote from the KJV Bible.
questions.explanation:
handmaid.

	Mary's proclamation can be found in Luke 1:38 (KJV). Upon hearing the angel's words Mary went to see her cousin Elizabeth, who was pregnant.

questions.text: Isaiah announced in Isaiah 7:14 (King James Version), "Behold a virgin shall conceive and bear a son and shall call his name ________." What is the missing name in this version?
questions.explanation:
Immanuel.

	Isaiah goes on to say in Isaiah 7:15 that Immanuel will eat butter and honey and will know to refuse evil and do good.

questions.text: Who was being spoken to when it was said in the KJV, "Behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he is just and having salvation"?
questions.explanation:
Daughters of Zion and Jerusalem.

	Zechariah 9:9 (KJV) says, "Rejoice greatly, O daughters of Zion; shout, O daughters of Jerusalem: behold thy King cometh unto thee: he is just and having salvation; lowly and riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass."

questions.text: In Psalm 51:5 (KJV), David said, "Behold I was shapen in ________ and in sin did my mother conceive me." What is David's missing word?
questions.explanation:
Iniquity.

	David spoke this Psalm after he committed adultery with Bathsheba.
